Dear Ms. Sears:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 16, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,
Deborah Will, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except:
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(2) The annual reevaluation shall include a determination
and assessment of all of the following:
(d) Compliance with the licensing rules for foster
homes.
One of six reevaluations had no signed 3080 in the file or
MISACWIS
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(a) – (j)
Two of four DHHS-69b’s were not completed before the
change of placement took place.
2.) The facility is in compliance with all ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract violation. The facility
is in compliance with all additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements except for
the following:
SRM 200 Security Awareness Training (SAT)
12 of 13 employees with access to CHRI did not complete SAT
training within 6 months of hire or every 2 years thereafter.
4

FOM 802, pg 1 Mental Health Screening within 30 days
One of eight ASQs/PSCs was not completed within 30 days of
entering care/transfer of case or at least once yearly thereafter
(repeat policy noncompliance from 2019)
FOM 722-08C Required participation -
Caregivers and youth 14+ are to participate in the
development of treatment plans
3 of 29 PATPs were not signed by the caregiver or 14+ youth.
One was not signed by the caregiver. Two were not signed by
IL youths.
ADM 400, pg 2 MARE within 30 days of case acceptance
One of three children available for adoption was not registered
on MARE within 30 days.
ADM 330, pg 1 Quarterly Progress Report Timeliness
One quarterly for one of three children was not completed
within 90 days of the child assessment or the last quarterly
IV. CONSULTATION
I held a two-hour training via Teams with licensing workers and the licensing
Supervisor discussing COVID work arounds, the SER analysis section, the order
of special evaluation interviews, double-citing and improving the quality of corrective
action plans.
During COVID restrictions and/or presumed positive cases in a foster home, all
efforts should be made to conduct at least one virtual visit inside of the home for
reevaluations.
Supporting documents for reevaluations should be printed, placed in the foster home
file and uploaded to MiSACWIS. Sensitive client information should not be
maintained on personal devices and should be deleted as soon the information is
printed or backed up on a work device.
5

The follow-up referral section at the bottom of the ASQ should be finished by the
worker and not left blank.
All documents should be checked to verify they are completed before uploading
to MiSACWIS. Unfinished and unsigned documents should not be uploaded.
V. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no safety alerts or foster home concerns identified by the DCWL
Analyst John Joubert.
There were two incidents of substantiated child abuse or neglect during this
licensing period. In both cases, the children were removed from the homes and
the agency recommended the foster home licenses be revoked.
There was one incident of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period. It was determined the foster father swung at a child in his care.
The corrective action plan included the foster father completing behavior
management training before any more children were referred to his home.
The agency had no DCWL investigation and thus were not required to submit any
corrective action plans during this licensing period.
During this Renewal inspection there was only one repeat policy noncompliance
from the last inspection. The agency submitted acceptable corrective action
plans for citations in December 2019:
R 400.12418 (2) (a) Development of service plans
R 400.12509 (3) (a – i) Independent living record
FOM 802 Mental Health Screening within 30 days (repeat from 12/2019)
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
